unnormalised: I’ve been getting so many questions lately about Indian govt-issued IDs, thought I’d share my experience. Specifically about getting my Aadhaar and PAN sorted out. It was…an adventure, to say the least.
normalised: I’ve been getting so many questions lately about Indian government issued I-Ds, thought I’d share my experience. Specifically about getting my Aadhaar and P-A-N sorted out. It was… an adventure, to say the least.

unnormalised: First, the Aadhaar. Applied online, pretty straightforward form asking for details like name, address, DOB (24/06/1988), etc. Uploaded copies of my Class 10 marksheet and voter ID as proof. The trouble started with the biometrics. The nearest Aadhaar Kendra was ages away, in Sector 62, Noida. Finally got there, waited in line for 3 hours! The lady at the counter keyed in my Aadhaar No. (4567-8901-2345), took my fingerprints, and an eye scan. Phew, thought I was done.
normalised: First, the Aadhaar. Applied online, pretty straightforward form asking for details like name, address, D-O-B (twenty fourth june nineteen eighty eight), etcetera. Uploaded copies of my Class ten marksheet and voter I-D as proof. The trouble started with the biometrics. The nearest Aadhaar Kendra was ages away, in Sector sixty two, Noida. Finally got there, waited in line for three hours! The lady at the counter keyed in my Aadhaar Number (four thousand five hundred and sixty seven dash eight thousand nine hundred and one dash two thousand three hundred and forty five), took my fingerprints, and an eye scan. Phew, thought I was done.

unnormalised: Then, months later, still no Aadhaar card! Turns out, there was a mismatch in my mother’s name. Had to go back, fill out another form, re-submit the documents. Finally received my Aadhaar Card. Lesson learned: double-check EVERYTHING!
normalised: Then, months later, still no Aadhaar card! Turns out, there was a mismatch in my mother’s name. Had to go back, fill out another form, re-submit the documents. Finally received my Aadhaar Card. Lesson learned: double-check EVERYTHING!

unnormalised: The PAN card wasn’t much easier. Applied online again, but this time, the website kept crashing. Uploaded my Aadhaar card and my driving license (DL No. UP1620100001234). Paid the application fee of Rs. 106.90. Received my PAN card after about 2 weeks. So, yeah, dealing with these documents can be frustrating, but they’re essential for everything from opening a bank account to filing taxes. Good luck to anyone navigating the same process!
normalised: The P-A-N card wasn’t much easier. Applied online again, but this time, the website kept crashing. Uploaded my Aadhaar card and my driving license (D-L Number U-P-one six two zero one zero zero zero zero one two three four). Paid the application fee of rupee one hundred and six point nine zero. Received my P-A-N card after about two weeks. So, yeah, dealing with these documents can be frustrating, but they’re essential for everything from opening a bank account to filing taxes. Good luck to anyone navigating the same process!
